snippet: Ike Davis, who was demoted in June to find his swing, is leading the majors in August with a .706 on-base percentage, but his power has been absent.
abstract: Benjamin Hoffman Keeping Score column on New York Mets first baseman Ike Davis, whose on-base percentage has increased 80 points, to .325 from .242, with only one home run; says although his recent hot streak may be a mirage, team must be happy to have anything positive to say about Davis, who was demoted to Class AA Las Vegas at the beginning of the season.
lead_paragraph: Ike Davis, who was demoted in June to find his swing, is leading the majors in August with a .706 on-base percentage, but his power has been absent.

headline.main: Getting on Base a Lot Helps a Team Only So Much
headline.print_headline: Getting on Base a Lot Helps a Team Only So Much
